question_text: A 45-year-old woman is evaluated for a 6-month history of symmetric small-joint pain and morning stiffness that lasts 90 minutes.Hand findings are shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: The most likely diagnosis is rheumatoid arthritis (Option C), a symmetric polyarthritis that involves the small joints of the hands and feet and other joints throughout the body. This patient has swelling of the third and fourth proximal interphalangeal joints. Rheumatoid arthritis most characteristically affects the metacarpophalangeal joints, metatarsophalangeal joints, and proximal interphalangeal joints of the hands and feet but spares the distal interphalangeal joints of the upper and lower extremities.
